name: Josiah D. Hester
content: Josiah Hester | Associate Professor | Georgia Tech College of Computing Josiah Hester Associate Professor of Interactive Computing and Computer Science Director, Center for Advancing Responsible Computing College of Computing, Georgia Institute of Technology Director, Ka Moamoa â Ubiquitous and Mobile Computing Lab BIO: Im an Associate Professor in the College of Computing at Georgia Tech. My work focuses on reimagining computing for sustainability, with applications in healthcare, conservation interactivity and education. [My CV] [Google Scholar] [Videos] I direct Ka Moamoa at Georgia Tech, a multidisciplinary research lab working to reduce the carbon costs of computing, and design computing such that it is more sustainable, durable, and useful to all. We are motivated by global scale applications ranging from health wearables/implants to conservation, interaction, and education. We explore and develop new hardware designs, systems, interaction techniques, tools, curriculum, and programming abstractions so that anyone can learn about, design, debug, and deploy more sustainable computing systems that work despite frequent power failures, constrained resources, and unpredictable conditions. I work towards a sustainable future for computing informed by my Native Hawaiian (KÄnaka Maoli) heritage. I apply my work in the field of intermittent computing to large-scale sensing for sustainability and conservation, health wearables, and interactive devices. My work is supported by multiple grants from the NSF, NIH, ARPA-H, DARPA, DoD, 3M, VMware, and the Sloan Foundation. I won a Presidential Early Career Award for Scientists and Engineers (PECASE) in 2025, was named a Sloan Fellow in Computer Science, won my NSF CAREER and a VMware Early Career Faculty Award in 2022. I was named to Popular Scienceâs Brilliant 10, the AISES Most Promising Scientist, and won a 3M Non-Tenured Faculty Award in 2021. Press highlights: Popular Science, Scientific American, The Mirror, Washington Post, TechCrunch, Gizmodo, Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists, Independent, The Wall Street Journal, CNET, Communications of the ACM, BBC, Guinness Book of World Records, Seeker, ACM Tech News. Ongoing Research Projects Large-scale Sustainable Sensing: soil powered compute, sustainable cyber-infrastructure and data sovereignty. NSF CAREER: Adaptive Intermittent Computing: modular hardware, runtimes, tools. [Learn More] Mobile Health: smart face masks, wearable cameras, eating monitoring, and smoking detection Implantable Pharmacy: ovarian cancer treatment with implanted living cells, and sleep therapy. Carbon-aware IoT: carbon nutrition labels and design tools for Internet-of-Things and Edge devices. Sustainable Robotics: Energy harvesting flapping UAVs, soft recyclable actuators. Low/No Power Interactive Systems: interaction powered devices, a battery-free Game Boy, and Python or Block based programming for energy harvesting devices.
